title: Fix deployment and finalize romantic single-page birthday surprise

requirements.text: Resolve the current deployment/build failure and ensure the project can be built and deployed successfully using the standard Internet Computer template workflow.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build completes without errors in the standard project workflow.
A deploy completes without errors and the frontend loads in a browser.

requirements.text: Ensure the experience is iPad Chrome friendly: responsive layout, large touch targets for the single "Open" button, and no hover-only interactions required to use the app.

quotes: be fully interactive using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: On a tablet-sized viewport, the button remains fully visible without scrolling.
The "Open" button is easily tappable (no tiny hit area), and the reveal action works via touch.

requirements.text: When the user clicks the "Open" button, display a letter-style view that includes the exact provided birthday message text (including emojis and line breaks) as the main content of the revealed letter.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Open" replaces (or overlays) the initial single-action view with a letter-style presentation.
The revealed message text matches the user-provided text exactly, including emojis and the explicit line break between "thi" and "Us".

requirements.text: Add and use locally-rendered romantic static image assets (no backend image fetching) to support the envelope/letter reveal presentation.
acceptanceCriteria: All images used for the envelope/letter reveal are included as static frontend assets and referenced locally.
No frontend code requests images from the backend at runtime.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui; compose them instead.
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx.
Keep backend logic within the single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo) if any backend changes are required.
Use a red-and-white romantic theme consistently; do not introduce unrelated color palettes.
nonGoals: Adding multiple pages, navigation, or additional actions beyond the single "Open" primary action.
User accounts, Internet Identity login, or any authentication flow.
Persisting messages or user state in the backend.
Integrations with external APIs or third-party services.
